Articles.Content:
3 hours ago, Vanamonde said:

It's all one account now. 

Also, we've got quite a few threads like this now, so this one has been consolidated into one of the existing ones. 

thanks for combining my accounts!

land on the mun

The Rocket was one of Matt lowne's craft files

 

Edited August 30, 2021 by MrSpaceCarrot
My most proud moment was when without any help I landed an ssto booster back at the KSC

Proudest and relief....

Back when still playing 1.0.5:

Launched a mission to Eve having a lander crewed with a Mk1-3.

Woefully underestimated Δv, and ended up sending rescue lander after rescue lander, along with the required rovers to retrieve and transport crew for hours on end when missing the landing zone.

It took 6 missions to finally get a Mk1-3 capsule into a stable orbit with only 50m/s to spare. I was playing as immersively/seriously as I could, so it was all I did for a month to get my crew home.

mine was problebly when i landed on the mun for the first time, i was so happy that i threw  my mouse in the air.

Edited March 8, 2019 by Sweetnsaltyish

2 hours ago, Sweetnsaltyish said:

mine was problebly when i landed on the mun for the first time, i was so happy that i threw  my mouse in the air.

Welcome to the forum, Sweetnsaltyish. We already had a thread like this so yours has been merged into it, but meanwhile, my proudest moment was also my first Mun landing. I took a zillion screenshots.

First Mun landing in 1.0.4, before first 6th month, also First Eve Direct Ascent round trip, first Jool 5, pulled over 2500 Science with some low Kerbol Science, in HALF Science gains, and also landing my 320 Ton to orbit SSTO lifter, for someone around my age (17), i'm quite capable, especially compared to average Indonesians, one day...this will be my Grand Tour.
My first successful rendez-vous

When I made an SSTO, got it to space, delivered it's cargo, and flew back down to Kerbin without any issues. I'm surprised my craft even made it through re-entry, let alone being able to pull up and not slam into the ocean

My proudest (and my most nail-biting) moment was when I did the Jool-5 in an SSTO.

 

  • https://kerbalx.com/Mars-Bound_Hokie/T-6-Cannonball - craft file of the beast that pulled it off.
  • https://imgur.com/gallery/luIEBS9 - imgur album

On 3/10/2019 at 9:21 AM, Rover 6428 said:

My first successful rendezvous

same here

When I landed on Tylo for the first time ago a few months ago.

Interestingly enough, I overengineered the return craft so badly it was able to go from Kerbin orbit to Tylo and back to Kerbin orbit, and still had enough fuel to probably go to Duna and back. I'm reusing the original core stage for my Duna mission, and using the design for my planned Moho Mission.

 

Edited July 24, 2020 by DunaManiac

Ah yes, my fully stock Automatic gun, or cannon...

Needless to say my battleships did not stand a chance against the plunging fire from 35 kilometres away

On 7/25/2020 at 12:27 AM, DunaManiac said:

When I landed on Tylo for the first time ago a few months ago.

Interestingly enough, I overengineered the return craft so badly it was able to go from Kerbin orbit to Tylo and back to Kerbin orbit, and still had enough fuel to probably go to Duna and back. I'm reusing the original core stage for my Duna mission, and using the design for my planned Moho Mission.

 

never been able to land manual on Tylo. In my experience mechjeb also messes up a lot here. 

For me my coolest moment was hardbrake: firebird 1. 

Yes its an huge base and stuff during an 7 g aerobrake on Duna who is cool. 
But it was also an mission I managed to recover by doing an far more violent aerobrake than planned. It required me to do a lots of simulations on the test version of game and moving parts of the ship around to even out drag as main problem here was that at over 7 g just small drag differences would make the ship go sideway, break up in the middle and then explode.

I recently had a few good "proud" moments recently. First off, I'm on my way to complete a very difficult contract of sending a kerbal to a comet before it gets sent back into the Oort cloud. I've already landed on it and gotten a few samples from it, and now the ship's on its way home. Should be back in about a year and a half kerbal time, which I think is pretty good, considering it was basically on a trajectory that would almost take it out of the solar system. The other achievement has to do with a recently designed space shuttle that I've finally finished, and is now my best flying shuttle I've made to date. It can haul a little over 30 tons to LKO, and can even go to places like Mun or Minmus orbit with around 5-10 tons, although getting back may be a problem. But my favorite part is that it flies so good, both on accent and decent, and doesn't stall or flip out. I love it!

My kOS driven precision Mun landing

 

ETA:

In fact I was pretty damn proud of that entire mission and plan to repeat it in my current game once I finish rejigging and updating all my kOS scripts

https://imgur.com/gallery/Zv7OU9J

 

Edited July 30, 2020 by RizzoTheRat

All time favourite Kerbal thing was last Halloween when I opened the door and was greeted by a 4 foot Kerbal in full costume.

 

When I asked if he was Jeb Kerbal the kid was so excited that somebody had finally recognized him.
Mine was landing on Duna and actually taking off and getting back to Kerbal. I did a LOT of refueling from Ike.

Hm. My PROUDEST ...

Well Allot In 1 Day. First time going to orbit, First time making a space station And First time launching a rocket.
The time when I finished my first Jool-5.(I have no idea if I have enough fuel)
First rendezvous, it was the first thing I did that challenged me more than setting up my first Mün encounter, like the Mün encounter its now routine.

This was all years ago... just recently came back to the game.

The first time I managed to rendezvous and dock two parts of a modular space station together blew my mind.

But probably my PROUDEST moment would be the rescue mission after I stranded a kerbal in orbit around the Mun - it was early in the tech tree, and the craft didn't have a docking port, so I had no way to refuel it.

So I concocted a second ship with a four-prong array of scaffold blocks mounted at the front, which flew out to the Mun, made rendezvous with the stranded craft, carefully butted the scaffold scoop up against it at the correct angle, and slowly engaged the main thruster, to shunt it into a return trajectory that would just skim the Kerbin atmosphere.  The mission was a resounding success, and all crew returned unscathed!

Docking at the space station without RCS thrusters.

Never again!

My proudest moment has to be when I first put a satellite into orbit around the Earth (not Kerbin) in RP-1 all on my own. Thats something I never forgot. Used an R-7 replica.

Since then I've landed astronauts on the Moon several times and sent probes to different places using gravity assists, which are both certainly harder challenges in Realism Overhaul and in playing KSP as a whole by far, but the first time making orbit in RSS/RO is an unforgettable experience.
Thats why I never could get back to playing standard KSP, its just not the same after all that.
Probably either my first space shuttle (which also landed on the runway, and was my first runway landing), or my Ike lander (first manned-and-return landing from anywhere further out than Minmus)
